Module execute
Package org.zuky.dialogs

Class FontDialog

java.lang.Object
org.zuky.dialogs.FontDialog
public class FontDialog extends Object
Allows you to select a font from the system and give it size and style. The dialog box also has a sample text to see the applied styles.
See Also:
  • Font Dialog Box - Win32

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    FontDialog()
    Create a new instance of this class
    FontDialog(Font font)
    Receives a font to be displayed as default font in the dialog box

  • Method Details

    • show

      public boolean show(Window window)
      Displays the dialog box specifying the parent window for the modal state
      Parameters:
      window - - the parent window
      Returns:
      true if the dialog box was closed correctly or false if it was canceled or an error occurred.

    • getFont

      public Font getFont()
      Returns the font that was selected but if in such a case no font was selected then the method returns null or the model font.
      Returns:
      font
      See Also:
      • setFont(Font)

    • setFont

      public void setFont(Font font)
      Sets the model font to be displayed in the dialog box.
      Parameters:
      font - model font
      See Also:
      • getFont()

    • setEnabledEffects

      public void setEnabledEffects(boolean effects)
      Enables the effects and styles to be applied to the sample text in the dialog box
      Parameters:
      effects - enable or disable

    • isEnabledEffects

      public boolean isEnabledEffects()
      Returns true if visual effects and styles are enabled.
      Returns:
      enable effects

    • getColor

      public Color getColor()
      Returns the color that was used in the sample text.

      Default color is black

      Returns:
      color
      See Also:
      • setColor(Color)

    • setColor

      public void setColor(Color color)
      Sets the color of the sample text in the dialog box. If the color has some level of transparency then it is ignored.
      Parameters:
      color - text color
      See Also:
      • getColor()

    • show

      public boolean show()
      Display the dialog box without defining a parent window
      Returns:
      true if the dialog box was closed correctly or false if it was canceled or an error occurred.
      See Also:
      • show(Window)
